title: Robert Downey Jr:Robert Downey Jr. Goes From Iron Man To Animal Doctor In Dolittle Trailer & Fans Have Mixed Feelings
text:
Robert Downey Jr. Goes From Iron Man To Animal Doctor In Dolittle Trailer & Fans Have Mixed Feelings

Robert Downey Jr. Goes From Iron Man To Animal Doctor In Dolittle Trailer & Fans Have Mixed Feelings

Who doesn’t remember Doctor Dolittle? The classic character who can talk to animals! The character which was created by Hugh Lofting in 1920s a series of children’s books set in the Victorian era, was played by Rex Harrison in 1967 musical, before Eddie Murphy starred in its cinematic adaptation in 1998 and also its sequel in 2001.

Now, our old favourite Doctor Dolittle is back for a new adventure, and guess who’s playing the role? Our Iron Man alias Robert Downey Jr!

The first trailer of Dolittle is out and Robert Downey Jr. can be seen talking to animals. So, he is back, not with his superheroes this time. But with his furry friends.

Isn’t he looking adorable as usual. After kissing goodbye to Marvel Cinematic Universe, Robert Downey Jr. has donned a doctor’s look, and fans are loving it!

Don't Miss 1.2 K SHARES 369 SHARES 727 SHARES 1.8 K SHARES

The movie also stars Octavia Spencer, Marion Cotillard, Jim Broadbent, Emma Thompson, Michael Sheen, Ralph Fiennes and Antonio Banderas. It will feature voices of stars like Selena Gomez as Betsy the giraffe, Tom Holland as Jip the dog, Rami Malek as Chee-Chee the gorilla and John Cena as Yoshi the polar bear.

The official synopsis of the movie reads, "After losing his wife seven years earlier, the eccentric Dr. John Dolittle (Downey), famed doctor and veterinarian of Queen Victoria's England, hermits himself away behind the high walls of Dolittle Manor with only his menagerie of exotic animals for company.

"But when the young queen (Jessie Buckley) falls gravely ill, a reluctant Dolittle is forced to set sail on an epic adventure to a mythical island in search of a cure, regaining his wit and courage as he crosses old adversaries and discovers wondrous creatures."

Dolittle is set to release on Jan 17, 2020.
